info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 3:35PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches with locally higher amounts of 6 to 9 inches possible. Wind gusts 45 to 65 mph will result in blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Portions of Central Siskiyou County, particularly the Weed area at the Interstate 5 to Highway 97 junction to Grass Lake as well as Forest Mountain Summit on Highway 3. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to near white-out conditions, at times. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow and strongest winds are expected during the day Monday. Snow is likely to change to rain Monday evening into Monday night in the Weed area. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
